replay,8,roles001,CIN,welkt901,CIN09,I,N,I,,H $Scott Rolen's fly to right center hit off the hands of a fan in the first row of seats as Angel Pagan made a leaping attempt to catch the ball; 2B umpire Bill Welke ruled it a home run but Mets manager Jerry Manuel asked about the call, thinking it was fan interference; crew chief Tim Welke watched the replay and after a 1:45 delay, upheld the call

ej,roles001,P,wendh902,Called third strike ej,baked002,M,wendh902,Called third strike on Rolen $the called third strike to Scott Rolen appeared to be low and well out of the strike zone; Rolen immediately started yelling at HP umpire Hunter Wendelstedt, who ejected Rolen; Reds manager Dusty Baker ran out but was too late to help Rolen; Baker started yelling at Wendelstedt and was ejected, too

$Utley damaged right thumb sliding into second, left for hitter in 9th

ej,manuc101,M,buckc901,Balls and strikes $Phillies Manager Charlie Manuel complained from the dugout about the second pitch to Raul Ibanez, saying it was low; HP umpire CB Bucknor told him to stop and Manuel came out of the dugout; as soon as Manuel reached the field, he was ejected by Bucknor; Manuel came to the plate and yelled for a bit and before he left the field, he hit Bucknor on the forehead with the brim of his cap

replay,8,olivm001,COL,hallt901,CIN09,I,N,I,,H $Miguel Olivo's fly was caught by a fan in the front row in LF; the Reds thought the fan reached over the wall so crew chief Tom Hallion watched the replay and upheld the call

replay,3,harrw001,WAS,cedeg901,CIN09,O,N,I,,H $Willie Harris' fly hit the yellow padding on the top of the RF wall at the bullpen and caromed back onto the field; Harris stopped at 2B but saw Reds RF Jay Bruce chasing the ball in foul territory, so Harris ran to 3B; the Nationals thought the ball was over the fence so crew chief Gary Cederstrom watched the replay and upheld the call
$Medlen was hit on the right arm
Braves pitcher Kris Medlen left the game due to an injured arm
$Reds RF Chris Heisey, who had just replaced Jay Bruce to start the inning, leaped at the wall and took away a go-ahead home run from Brooks Conrad

ej,cabro001,P,davib902,Balls and strikes $Martin Prado injured his right pinky finger when he slid across the plate; his right hand got caught under his body as he touched the plate with his left hand; during the delay, Reds shortstop Orlando Cabrera yelled at HP umpire Bob Davidson about the strike zone during his last at bat in the previous half inning; Cabrera was ejected by Davidson

ej,baked002,M,wegnm901,Fight between teams ej,larut101,M,wegnm901,Fight between teams $Reds second baseman Brandon Phillips had talked about the Cardinals, saying he hated them; as he stepped to the plate to start the first inning, he tried to tap catcher Yadier Molina on the shin guard; Molina kicked the bat away so Phillips tapped again and then stepped out of the batter's box to take a practice swing; Molina stepped on the plate and got in Phillips' face as the latter stepped into the box; Phillips removed his helmet and answered Molina, who then removed his mask; tempers flared and both benches cleared; the two managers started yelling at each other and had to be separated by the umpires; then Cardinals pitcher Chris Carpenter started chirping at the Reds manager Dusty Baker; Reds player Scott Rolen, who used to be a teammate, went after Carpenter; then some wrestling started and the scrum moved to the backstop; there was a lot of punching and Reds pitcher Johnny Cueto kicked Cardinals pitcher Jason LaRue, who suffered a slight concussion and facial tears; Carpenter was scraped up when he was pushed into the backstop netting in the scrum and then kicked in the back by Cueto; both Cardinals manager Tony LaRussa and Reds manager Dusty Baker were ejected by HP umpire Mark Wegner
$Colby Rasmus hit his first grand slam on his 24th birthday
$Rhodes came in to pitch top of 8th and game was delayed by for 46 minutes.  When the game was resumed, Rhodes was replaced by Masset

ej,vottj001,P,reybd901,Balls and strikes $Reds first baseman Joey Votto complained from the on deck area about a pitch to Jay Bruce; after the second pitch to Votto, he stepped out of the box and said something to HP umpire D.J. Reyburn, who ejected Votto

replay,5,brucj001,CIN,welkt901,CIN09,I,N,I,,H $Jay Bruce's fly ball was touched and almost caught by a fan in CF; the ball was over the wall but it looked as if Brewers CF Lorenzo Cain would have caught the ball if the fan had not touched it; however, since it was over the wall, it was ruled a home run; the ball ended up on the field; the Brewers argued for fan interference, so crew chief Tim Welke watched the replay and upheld the call
